abstract: Obama administration's order that law enforcement agencies across United States return surplus military equipment to federal government by April 1 has prompted complaints from some agencies; supporters of plan say equipment is unnecessary and can fuel police use of excessive force, while detractors hold military equipment helps officers in changed and increasingly violent world.
snippet: A federal order will deprive local authorities of critical tools in an age of heightened fears about terrorism and mass shootings, some law enforcement leaders say....

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: A federal order will deprive local authorities of critical tools in an age of heightened fears about terrorism and mass shootings, some law enforcement leaders say.

headline.main: Some Officers Bristle at Recall of Military Equipment
headline.print_headline: U.S. Taking Back Military Gear From Local Law Enforcement
